instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2262: What is 820-2262? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.CHGR_PHASE: What is CHGR_PHASE? CHGR_PHASE is charger voltage chopped up into individual slices prior to smoothing where it becomes PPBUS_G3H.
definitions.5V_S5: What is 5V_S5? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for ‚ÄúPP5V_S5‚Äù which is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2262</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power, no MagSafe light
threads.message:
Hi everyone.
I have an A1261 17" MacBook Pro (old, I know) that I'm trying to fix. The board is a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2262</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.
I have no solid MagSafe light: it blinks regularly but very faintly, sometimes green, sometimes orange. You can hear a very light clicking from the board when the light blinks.
I measured all the basic power rails, including <SIGNAL>PP18V5_DCIN</SIGNAL>, and they all fluctuate between 0 and the target voltage. Even the OneWire circuit fluctuates.
The charger is an original 85W Apple charger, but I tried a load of different bricks and there's no difference.
No liquid damage, no previous repairs.
I need some advice... thank you!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2262</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power, no MagSafe light
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

If <SIGNAL>PP18V5_DCIN</SIGNAL> fluctuates, very likely original charger detects some problem on the ACIN Detection, or Inrush Limiter circuit.
<CHIP>U6900</CHIP> is the first suspect; <TRANSISTOR>Q6950</TRANSISTOR> may have leakage too.

Check if get stable voltages using fake charger, or lab PSU.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2262</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power, no MagSafe light
threads.message:
Thank you!
Will do as soon as I get to the Mac!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2262</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power, no MagSafe light
threads.message:
Please, write directly on the Reply box, instead of clicking Reply button.
No reason to quote an entire post, visible few centimeters above.
We try to maintain forum aesthetic...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2262</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power, no MagSafe light
threads.message:
Right, sorry!
I got a steady green light with a fake charger. Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q6950</TRANSISTOR>, got a green light with the Apple charger. Tested rails:

<SIGNAL>PP18V5_DCIN</SIGNAL>= 18.38V (at F6900 and <TRANSISTOR>Q6950</TRANSISTOR> pin 1-3)
<SIGNAL>PP18V5_G3H_CHGR</SIGNAL>= 18.38V (at <TRANSISTOR>Q6950</TRANSISTOR> pin 5-8)
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>= 17.59V (at <CAPACITOR>C7800</CAPACITOR>)
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>= 3.33V (at L7810)
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>= 0,31V (at <CAPACITOR>C7155</CAPACITOR>)

After a while, it got back to the initial status and now I have a short to ground on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>. <TRANSISTOR>Q6950</TRANSISTOR> gets hot (alcohol immediately evaporates on top of it) and charger LED pulses again even with fake charger.
Should I inject some low voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and check for heat on components?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2262</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power, no MagSafe light
threads.message:
What is the exact ohm resistance to ground at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?
Compare the reading with the values from the big coils (to ground).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2262</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power, no MagSafe light
threads.message:
Ok, I found the short. It was not on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, found by disconnecting L7900 and isolating the short to the <SIGNAL>CHGR_PHASE</SIGNAL> side. 
<TRANSISTOR>Q7902</TRANSISTOR> had shorted itself internally to ground, replacing that allowed the board to turn on and have fanspin. The problem now is that the whole 18.5V from the charger is passed to <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, so other than fan activity (at full blast), there is not much else.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2262</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power, no MagSafe light
threads.message:
Replace <TRANSISTOR>Q7901</TRANSISTOR>; is shorted too.

Be sure <DIODE>D7900</DIODE> and <RESISTOR>R7903</RESISTOR> are both OK.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2262</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power, no MagSafe light
threads.message: Diode and resistor are ok. Replacing <TRANSISTOR>Q7901</TRANSISTOR> (I swear it wasn't shorted before changing <TRANSISTOR>Q7902</TRANSISTOR> ahah)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2262</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power, no MagSafe light
threads.message:
Ok now it doesn't turn on anymore (a brief little movement from the fan) and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 11.92V
Original charger pulses again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2262</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power, no MagSafe light
threads.message:
Do you get stable <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with fake charger?
If yes, check 3V3/<SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL> if present.

"I swear it wasn't shorted before changing <TRANSISTOR>Q7902</TRANSISTOR> ahah"
If you think about short to ground, is true; wasn't.
But I didn't talk about short to ground; <TRANSISTOR>Q7901</TRANSISTOR> was shorted D-S!!!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2262</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power, no MagSafe light
threads.message:
Not anymore, and the short on <TRANSISTOR>Q7902</TRANSISTOR> has returned.
What am I doing wrong?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2262</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power, no MagSafe light
threads.message:
You must check/change both <TRANSISTOR>Q7901</TRANSISTOR>/02 at same time.
If one of <RESISTOR>R7903</RESISTOR>, or <DIODE>D7900</DIODE> is bad, then <TRANSISTOR>Q7901</TRANSISTOR> will burn again; after that, <TRANSISTOR>Q7902</TRANSISTOR> will burn easy too.
Be sure to have good solders and traces.
If Gate pin of <TRANSISTOR>Q7901</TRANSISTOR> remains "on air", it will get burnt.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2262</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power, no MagSafe light
threads.message: I‚Äôll check again tomorrow. I noticed that if I spray some alcohol on that zone of the PCB, the MagSafe light goes out and starts blinking‚Ä¶ could this give you a hint on what‚Äôs happening?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2262</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power, no MagSafe light
threads.message: Probably a good idea to replace <CHIP>U7900</CHIP> at the same time as <TRANSISTOR>Q7901</TRANSISTOR>/<TRANSISTOR>Q7902</TRANSISTOR>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2262</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power, no MagSafe light
threads.message:
Believe it or not, that‚Äôs the absolute first thing I did even before writing on this forum. No difference.

<RESISTOR>R7903</RESISTOR> is 2.8ohms vs the 2.2 it should be as per schematic (on my donor board it‚Äôs the same thing, 2.8 vs 2.2).
<DIODE>D7900</DIODE> is .163 on one way in diode mode and 33Kohm in resistance mode the other way.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2262</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power, no MagSafe light
threads.message: After resoldering <CHIP>U7900</CHIP>, I get a solid green light. No <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <CHIP>U7900</CHIP> gets really hot (I cannot touch it with my finger, it will burn me).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2262</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power, no MagSafe light
threads.message:
Then this <CHIP>U7900</CHIP> is bad.
Check diode mode to ground at its pins 25, 13, 26.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2262</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power, no MagSafe light
threads.message:
.652 on 25
.533 on 13
.531 on 26

I will buy some more ISL6257s because I don't have them anymore ahah

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2262</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power, no MagSafe light
threads.message:
Strange, no low values at all.
Be sure to have correct resistance between pins 19/20 and 21/22.
Check for short (between their pins) <TRANSISTOR>Q7901</TRANSISTOR>/02.
Also check <DIODE>D7903</DIODE>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2262</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power, no MagSafe light
threads.message:
7.5Kohm 19/20 (seems a bit high...)
2.6Kohm 21/22

No short on <TRANSISTOR>Q7901</TRANSISTOR>/02.
<DIODE>D7903</DIODE> diode mode:
- positive on pin 1, negative on pin 3: .595
- positive on pin 3, negative on pin 1: .793

Should I replace <DIODE>D7903</DIODE> and the resistors on 19/20?
Sorry for all the questions, I'm quite new to this stuff!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2262</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power, no MagSafe light
threads.message:
Check <RESISTOR>R7904</RESISTOR>/5/6 and their traces.
As per schematic, calculate the resistance which you sould get between mentioned pins.
To be clear, measure between 19-20 and other measurment 21-22; didn't ask about measurements to ground.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2262</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power, no MagSafe light
threads.message:
Yeah values are resistance between pins, not to ground.
Is <RESISTOR>R7906</RESISTOR> supposed to be 2.2ohms or 2.2Kohms? Is it a typo in the schematic?

EDIT:
<RESISTOR>R7904</RESISTOR> is about 7 ohm (should be 0)
<RESISTOR>R7905</RESISTOR> is 5.7 Kohm (should be 18ohm)
<RESISTOR>R7906</RESISTOR> is 2.6 Kohm (should be 2.2ohm)
Thats if I can read a resistance unit properly üòÖ

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2262</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no power, no MagSafe light
threads.message:
[QUOTE="mikiotty, post: 82673, member: 5406"]
Is <RESISTOR>R7906</RESISTOR> supposed to be 2.2ohms or 2.2Kohms? Is it a typo in the schematic?
[/QUOTE]
No typo on the schematic - this is a filter resistor (along with <CAPACITOR>C7902</CAPACITOR> it does reduce the switching noise) so it is of such low value.

[QUOTE="mikiotty, post: 82673, member: 5406"]
<RESISTOR>R7904</RESISTOR> is about 7 ohm (should be 0)
<RESISTOR>R7905</RESISTOR> is 5.7 Kohm (should be 18ohm)
<RESISTOR>R7906</RESISTOR> is 2.6 Kohm (should be 2.2ohm)
[/QUOTE]
Of course all of these resistors must be replaced according to the schematic.
